intro: Mesembryanthemum lerouxiae, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant features fleshy, often hairy leaves and produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the early morning. It is well adapted to hot, dry climates and requires minimal water, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a valuable addition to rock gardens and desert landscapes.
